3.7.1.title: Purpose
3.7.1.content:
**Function:**
Direct uncontrolled flow away from the rig when shut-in is not possible or appropriate:
- Shallow gas situations
- Before surface casing cemented
- When formation cannot withstand shut-in pressure

**Key Concept:**
Diverter does NOT stop flow - it redirects flow to safe location away from personnel and equipment.

**When Used:**
- Shallow hole sections (conductor, surface hole)
- Before BOP installed
- Weak formation cannot handle shut-in

3.7.2.title: Components
3.7.2.content:
**Diverter Housing:**
- Mounted on conductor or riser
- Contains packer/sealing element
- Supports rotating equipment above

**Sealing Element:**
- Rubber packer element
- Closes around pipe
- Diverts flow from annulus to diverter lines

**Diverter Lines:**
- Large diameter (12" or larger typical)
- Route away from rig (downwind)
- Minimum bends to reduce friction
- May have multiple lines (select based on wind)

**Valves:**
- Diverter line valves (open before packer closes)
- Interlock prevents closing packer without line open
- Remote operation essential

3.7.3.title: Operation
3.7.3.content:
**Activation Sequence:**
1. Sound alarm
2. Increase pump rate (keep circulating)
3. Open diverter line valve (downwind line)
4. Close diverter packer
5. Maintain circulation at maximum safe rate
6. Evacuate non-essential personnel from area

**Critical Points:**
- NEVER close packer with lines closed (would shut in well)
- Keep circulating - stopping allows bridging
- Maximum pump rate dilutes and displaces gas
- Do not attempt to shut in

**Interlock:**
Most systems have interlock that opens line before packer can close. Verify interlock functions.

3.7.4.title: Testing
3.7.4.content:
**Function Test:**
- Test packer closes and opens
- Test line valves operate
- Verify interlock function
- Check remote operation from safe location

**Low Pressure Test:**
- Test packer sealing (low pressure only)
- Verify no bypassing
- Do not high-pressure test (would test formation)

**Frequency:**
- Before drilling surface hole
- Weekly while diverter is primary equipment
- After any maintenance

**Documentation:**
- Record all tests
- Note response times
- Verify remote operation works

3.7.5.title: Maintenance
3.7.5.content:
**Packer Element:**
- Inspect for wear and damage
- Replace if worn
- Have spare on location

**Lines:**
- Inspect for corrosion and damage
- Ensure clear of obstructions
- Check supports and anchoring

**Valves:**
- Operate regularly to prevent seizing
- Check actuators function
- Verify fail-safe position

**Control System:**
- Test controls at both panels
- Check hydraulic supply
- Verify alarms function
